alert.note: Alert for Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 7:27AM EST until December 20 at 1:40PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... East Branch Penobscot River At Grindstone affecting Penobscot County. Penobscot River At West Enfield affecting Penobscot County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... Piscataquis River Above Dover-Foxcroft affecting Piscataquis County. Piscataquis River At Medford affecting Penobscot and Piscataquis Counties. Penobscot River At Eddington affecting Penobscot County. For the Piscataquis River...including Blanchard, Dover-Foxcroft, Abbot Climate Station, Medford...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Penobscot River...including Mattawamkeag, Grindstone, West Enfield, Eddington, Bangor...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Penobscot River at Eddington. * WHEN...From late tonight to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding occurs. Swiftly moving water can pose an imminent threat to life. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 10.7 feet. - At 16.0 feet the river approaches bankfull. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 18.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.9 feet on 04/18/2014. - For flood safety visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 700 PM EST.
